getLocation

public <T extends ResourceLocation> T getLocation(String key)
                                       throws MissingLocationException
Description copied from interface: ResourceLoader
Access the stored location for the specified key. If the location does not exist for the specified key the an exception is thrown. Note: this is a generic method allow multiple return types providing they extend ResourceLocation. What this means is that if a LocationDescription requires a ResourceFileLocation you can call this method assigning to a variable of that type. ResourceFileLocation location = getLocation("chebi.sdf")

This is not type save so if the returned type does not extend the generic-type a ClassCastException will be thrown

Specified by:
getLocation in interface ResourceLoader
Parameters:
key - key to fetch a location
Returns:
instance extending ResourceLocation
Throws:
MissingLocationException - thrown if the location has not been added

canUpdate

public boolean canUpdate()
Description copied from interface: ResourceLoader
Determines whether required locations LocationDescription are accounted for via various ResourceLocations. Each location is checked with ResourceLocation.isAvailable() but this may not guarantee a error free ResourceLoader.update()

Specified by:
canUpdate in interface ResourceLoader
Returns:
can update resource

getRequiredResources

public Map<String,LocationDescription> getRequiredResources()
Description copied from interface: ResourceLoader
Access the LocationDescriptions of the ResourceLocations that are required for the ResourceLoader.update() method. The key's in map should be used when adding ResourceLocations in the method ResourceLoader.addLocation(String, ResourceLocation); This method is primarily useful for user-interface update managers where the user can change the location's of the resources

Specified by:
getRequiredResources in interface ResourceLoader
Returns:
map of location key's to their descriptions

cancel

public void cancel()
Description copied from interface: ResourceLoader
Cancel the update process. This method should inform the update process to terminate the update as soon as possible. The process should NOT automatically invoke ResourceLoader.backup(), this should be handled by an update manager.

Specified by:
cancel in interface ResourceLoader

isCancelled

public boolean isCancelled()
Determine whether the update has been cancelled

Reset the cancelled state (should be called before update)

uncancel in interface ResourceLoader
